Author: 𝙊𝙞𝙣𝙠#3612
Content: This ‘issue’ is completely unrelated to a wallet, which is just an interface between the user and the blockchain.

Author: 𝙊𝙞𝙣𝙠#3612
Content: I should even say ‘non-issue’.

Author: mobipoi#5774
Content: Ok I saw versus and this backdoor stuff and I thought the wallets

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it only affected the earliest miners

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and to date, not a single person has claimed their txid was involved, so it appears the verus team identified only their own mined funds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and recovered about two thirds of it, is my guess

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: until today, this was a totally open and resolved issue for over a year

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: granted it was unorthodox, but the only solution available and it did not impact any users, didnt increase coin emissions, didnt rollback the chain. what is the big deal?

Author: 𝙊𝙞𝙣𝙠#3612
Content: Personally I’m quite disappointed that it has been blown out of proportions and taken out of context, without verifying all details.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: calling what is clearly not a backdoor, a "backdoor" surely escalates the issue. there is likely no word for this as it is a pretty unique thing

Author: 𝙊𝙞𝙣𝙠#3612
Content: Thank you @jl777c for ~~rectifying~~ clarifying this situation so quickly.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: more a txid reclaimer

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is nothing wrong about describing technical things, but non-technical people rely on the technical to assess the details. we need to be more responsible about the terms that are used. ie. dont yell "FIRE!" in a crowded theater when somebody lights a cigarrette

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: technically there is fire involved when lighting a cigarrette, at least there used to be. but that does not mean it is a "FIRE"

Author: 𝙊𝙞𝙣𝙠#3612
Content: That’s a fine example of blowing out of proportion.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: backdoor implies a security exposure, here there is a specific list of vetted txids. you really cant call them the same. so let us read the post with "txid reclaimer" instead of "backdoor"

Author: peritonlogon#7708
Content:
Just looked at NXTer magazine for the first time in a year or so....still makes me sad how the community splintered.  There's not 
a lot that I miss about 2015-16 but the NXT community and the state it was in sure is something I do.  I think the biggest weakness of crypto is how easily it can get splintered, forked, rebranded, divided and abandoned.  The uniting force of the Bitcoin origin story and brand are what have and will keep it strong even against bitter divisions.

Author: gigamesh#3544
Content: in any case the timing of Duke's assault is perhaps correlated with my upcoming VRSC review. No sooner had i finished the HUSH review (and Duke and I were on really good terms) he read about my intent to review VRSC. He was not pleased.

Author: gigamesh#3544
Content: I mean to cover this topic in the VRSC review and try and put this matter to bed. However Duke is hardcore immutable believer and I doubt it'll sway him. At the same time I completely understand the rationale for VRSC;s actions (which were declared first). VRSC could perhaps have relaunched, but this would have probably created even more furor.

Content: Abandoning the project would have been a travesty
